description: The Windows standards-based storage management service experiences a complete loss of availability due to a denial of service vulnerability (CVE-2024-30083). As a result, users may notice that they cannot access certain resources that rely on the affected service. This issue may manifest as unresponsive applications or services that depend on storage operations, leading to potential disruptions in workflows. Systems affected include Windows Server 2012 R2, 2016, 2019, and 2022. The associated KB article for this issue is KB-5039330. The impact is reported as important and can affect both server core installations and full installations, resulting in significant downtime.
